body:
I haven't been playing on Avicus basically ever, and I've decided to make this post as to why, and maybe give some tips to help. First off I won't be leaving completely, just will rarely be playing, and not really be a part of the community much anymore. The main reason I have stopped playing was because I have noticed that most of the people have been very rude lately, and it's just not a fun environment anymore. 

I'm going to list a few things that Avicus can work on, some of them the staff team knows about, some maybe not. I don't want to cause a fight over this, I just wanted to point out the things I have noticed that needs fixed, I'm not going to be rude about it, I want this to be a calm post.

1. Block lag. This has been around for much, much too long, it needs to be fixed. <3

2. Bans that have been very, very wrong. An example is OpticSlinky. I was not there when this happened, but she was not hacking as far as I know, and she was banned for x-ray, fast ladder climb, and no head. This seems very strange to me. I have talked to her a little bit, and she said she was not hacking when this happened. I have also talked to people that were there, they all have said that she was not hacking. (This post was not to get her unbanned, I just have noticed a lot of bans for bad reasons, and I know the most about this one.)

3. Making tournaments for other games than DTM, there was a post about this not too long about, but it got a lot of hate from DTM players that find walls dumb. I understand that some of you don't like walls because it takes too long or what ever, but we have DTM tournaments a lot more than we do walls. Plus Avicus can't survive on only DTM. Advertising other games would be very helpful to Avicus. And it gives the walls people to get something for us, not just you guys. I also saw some DTM people that liked this idea, so I'm not just hating on DTM people, most of you are nice. <3
body_tagged:
I haven't been playing on Avicus basically ever, and I've decided to make this post as to why, and maybe give some tips to help. First off I won't be leaving completely, just will rarely be playing, and not really be a part of the community much anymore. The main reason I have stopped playing was because I have noticed that most of the people have been very rude lately, and it's just not a fun environment anymore. 

I'm going to list a few things that Avicus can work on, some of them the staff team knows about, some maybe not. I don't want to cause a fight over this, I just wanted to point out the things I have noticed that needs fixed, I'm not going to be rude about it, I want this to be a calm post.

1. Block lag. This has been around for much, much too long, it needs to be fixed. <3

2. Bans that have been very, very wrong. An example is OpticSlinky. I was not there when this happened, but she was not hacking as far as I know, and she was banned for x-ray, fast ladder climb, and no head. This seems very strange to me. I have talked to her a little bit, and she said she was not hacking when this happened. I have also talked to people that were there, they all have said that she was not hacking. (This post was not to get her unbanned, I just have noticed a lot of bans for bad reasons, and I know the most about this one.)

3. Making tournaments for other games than DTM, there was a post about this not too long about, but it got a lot of hate from DTM players that find walls dumb. I understand that some of you don't like walls because it takes too long or what ever, but we have DTM tournaments a lot more than we do walls. Plus Avicus can't survive on only DTM. Advertising other games would be very helpful to Avicus. And it gives the walls people to get something for us, not just you guys. I also saw some DTM people that liked this idea, so I'm not just hating on DTM people, most of you are nice. <3
title: Leaving and things I have noticed lately

replies.body: Calm down, it was an opinionated assumption — he never complained about anything or anyone. The only issue here is that you, among others, are overreacting and taking what he said as an offensive personal attack, which is not what he intended (or even did, for that matter). Moreover, it's already been thoroughly discussed in the past, and hosting a Walls tournament was determined not to be a viable option because of the nature of the game. As such, Walls would only be suited for mini-events, of which I believe some have already been held.
replies.body_tagged: Calm down, it was an opinionated assumption — he never complained about anything or anyone. The only issue here is that you, among others, are overreacting and taking what he said as an offensive personal attack, which is not what he intended (or even did, for that matter). Moreover, it's already been thoroughly discussed in the past, and hosting a Walls tournament was determined not to be a viable option because of the nature of the game. As such, Walls would only be suited for mini-events, of which I believe some have already been held.

Woah, woah, woah WOAH. Ok, saying 'no offense' does not make it fine to bitch about walls players.

Many walls players know about the forums, but just don't post on it, and you just assume that we wouldn't get organised...How? How do you have the right to say that we could not get organised? I disagree with your last point there...I don't want an argument. But currently you are shedding no light for us walls players...If there was a walls tourney, we would join. And so would nebula teams.

Usually people use caps to show even more anger. Yet I barely sweared. But I will not argue about something as pointless as this.

But you should first look at some other posts that people have made before judging mine. Looking at itzrilo's post would be a good example. I agree with what he said, but he did over react.

And yes, I know it's a block game. I mean everyone who plays minecraft knows that...Right?

Can we stop with the so-called argument that we are currently having? Or are you just going to keep on telling me to take chill pills till I choke on those damn things?

P.S I am 'chill'

replies.body:
Erm, I'm a walls player and I know that nebula players are better at pvp, they face it more, they are in pvp 24/7 (unless rushing)
Walls players don't face as much pvp, so we don't have as much experience.
We have ten minutes of zero combat! XD
Where during that time, a dtm match is already knees deep in combat.  It's just the truth, now there may be exceptions, like Endertrevor and Porcupine, that maybe could beat some decent nebula players, but overall, a decent walls player isn't the same level as a nebula player.

Just being honest here and stating some things that I think should be considered, love ya guys <3

Bai again micah XD

replies.body:
Holy shit, flame war OP. 

Nebula players have more experience in one game of nebula in PvP than walls players get in 10 games (well, unless you were there in the OG days with the tons of people and you hunted). 

OP: See ya michah, sad to see you go. :c

replies.body:
I don't actually. But alright. I do apologise for arguing in your leaving post, of course nobody replied to itzrilo's post...I guess I was 'special'

But sadly that's not a good thing :D

I didn't know you too much. But I do remember playing walls with you. I do remember getting wins with you that we shouldn't of won, and it was fun. Don't leave forever :D Bye
